archetype_name: Family Light & Fresh: Japanese and Vietnamese Weeknights
name: Ginger-Lime Chicken & Zucchini Rice Noodle Bowls (No Soy)
description: Light, herb-forward chicken and vegetables over rice noodles with a tangy ginger-lime dressing. Fresh and mild, inspired by Vietnamese herb bowls with a simple Japanese nori finish.
prep_steps: Bring a large pot of water to a boil for noodles.
Trim excess fat from chicken thighs; pat dry.
Peel and finely grate 1 garlic clove; mince the other.
Zucchini: halve lengthwise, then thinly slice into half-moons.
Carrots: peel and cut into thin matchsticks.
Cucumber: halve lengthwise, scrape seeds if watery, then thinly slice.
Basil and mint: pick leaves; tear larger leaves.
Lime: zest 1 lime (optional), then juice both limes into a small bowl.
In a small bowl, whisk dressing: lime juice (and zest if using), honey, rice vinegar, grated garlic, 1 tablespoon olive oil, a pinch of salt, and black pepper.
Optional: Cut nori into thin strips for garnish.
cook_steps: Season chicken thighs on both sides with 1/2 teaspoon salt and a few grinds of black pepper.
Heat a large skillet over medium-high on the stovetop. Sear chicken 4–5 minutes per side until cooked through; rest on a board, then slice into thin strips.
While chicken cooks, add rice noodles to the boiling water and cook until just tender (per pack timing, usually 4–6 minutes). Drain and rinse under cold water to stop cooking.

In the warm skillet, add zucchini and carrots with a splash of water; stir-fry 2–3 minutes until just crisp-tender. Add minced garlic; cook 30 seconds. Season lightly with salt and pepper. Remove from heat.
In a large bowl, toss noodles with half the dressing.
Add sliced chicken, zucchini-carrot mix, cucumber, basil, and mint to the noodles. Drizzle remaining dressing and toss gently to combine.
Taste and adjust salt and black pepper. Top with nori strips if using. Serve immediately.
